Crafting Your Cloud-Native Strategy A Complimentary Ebook
<[[https://content.pivotal.io/ebooks/crafting-your-cloud-native-strategy?utm_source=pivotal-email&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=q2-2017-eBook]]> <[[https://content.pivotal.io/ebooks/crafting-your-cloud-native-strategy?utm_source=pivotal-email&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=q2-2017-eBook]]>
Download
<[[https://content.pivotal.io/ebooks/crafting-your-cloud-native-strategy?utm_source=pivotal-email&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=q2-2017-eBook]]> Hi {{lead.First Name:default=there}},
“If Facebook and Netflix can do it, then why can’t we?” Switching to a cloud-native approach isn’t always easy, but it’s certainly possible. Cloud-native isn’t just for Silicon Valley companies; organizations like 80+ year old Allstate have successfully adopted a cloud-native approach and achieved 350% developer productivity improvements, speeding up their business.
In this complimentary eBook <[[https://content.pivotal.io/ebooks/crafting-your-cloud-native-strategy?utm_source=pivotal-email&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=q2-2017-eBook]]>, Pivotal’s Michael Coté addresses the organizational struggles and changes that come with becoming cloud-native and, hopefully, encourages you to get started on your cloud-native journey by providing just enough of a toolkit to bootstrap transformation.
The case studies and anecdotes covered in this booklet provide ample lessons from the first few years of early adopters.
Specifically, you will read about:
• IT’s role in the era of transient advantage • DevOps and agile software practices • Organizational change in cloud-native transformations • Risk management and security • Dealing with legacy applications • Using a cloud platform to automate, standardize and control code deployments
Thank you, The Pivotal Team
